text-decoration: none;\">November 17, 2016 at 10:28 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_154MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSir,<br />\n<br />\nMy cousin was planning for normal delivery.. no c-section / epidurals.... she even paased her due date.. at the end, her water broke and she fet no labor pains 5hrs after her water had broken.. she ended up having c-section...<br />\n<br />\nwhy no pains after water broke sir?</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_154BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_154b+seedgJQD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_152T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_154b+seedgJQD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_152TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_152TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_152TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_154b+seedgJQD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_152TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_152TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_154b+seedgJQD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_152TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_152TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_152TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_154b+seedgJQD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_152B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2632473167613619305\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_152M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/epidurals-when-chutney-mary-fails-her.html?showComment=1479361786367#c2632473167613619305\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">November 17, 2016 at 11:19 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_152MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi smp,<br />\n<br />\nIt doesn\u2019t hurt for your water bag to break \u2014 in fact, you may not even notice when it happens, unless you feel a little warm and wet down below. But for many women, the breaking of the water ushers in the painful part of labor.<br />\n<br />\nIf your water breaks before labor starts, it's called premature rupture of membranes (PROM).If your waters break before your baby has reached full term (37 weeks), the medical name for it is preterm prelabour rupture of the membranes, or PPROM.<br />\n<br />\nOver 80% of women who have PPROM deliver their baby within seven days of their waters breaking.<br />\n<br />\nIn an overwhelming majority of cases -- some 80 percent -- labor begins with contractions, then water breaking. In the other 20 percent, the water breaks first and is usually followed by labor pains within a few hours.<br />\n<br />\nThe likelihood is that your contractions will start within 24 hours to 48 hours of your water bag breaking. At least 60 per cent of women go into labour within 24 hours and most of the rest go into labour within 48 hours<br />\n<br />\nCaesarean rates are lower when women waited for labour to start compared with those who were induced.<br />\n<br />\nWhen your water bag breaks the amniotic fluid then leaks out via your cervix and vagina.<br />\n<br />\nThe bag of waters is made up of two layers of membranes<br />\n<br />\nMost women's waters break during labour, after contractions have already begun. The waters protect you and your baby from infection.<br />\n<br />\nSometimes waters break before any other signs of labour, including contractions. This happens for about one in 10 women .<br />\n<br />\nFor about one in 50, their waters break earlier than this, before they are 37 weeks pregnant. Once your waters have broken, you may notice that your contractions start to feel more intense.<br />\n<br />\nAmniotic fluid is almost 99 per cent water so it's normally clear with a yellow tinge or sometimes a pink tinge.<br />\n<br />\nIf you\u2019re close to or past your due date, your water may contain some of your baby's first poo (meconium). This may result in the waters having a green tinge to them, or you may be able to see green or brown meconium .<br />\n<br />\nIf your baby hasn't arrived within 24 hours after your water broke, your doctor may give you antibiotics intravenously. That's because there's a chance an infection can travel into the uterus and cause an infection in the baby<br />\nIf you experience premature rupture of membranes, your doctor might stimulate uterine contractions before labor begins on its own (labor induction). The longer it takes for labor to start after your water breaks, the greater the risk of you or your baby developing an infection.<br />\n<br />\nIf you are under 24 weeks of pregnancy and the baby is born, sadly, it is unlikely the baby will survive.<br />\n<br />\nIf you are over 30 weeks and the baby is born, the likelihood of your baby surviving is much higher - over 95%<br />\n<br />\nBefore 23 weeks, the baby needs \u2018waters\u2019 to be present for their lungs to develop normally. Loss of water before this can lead to severe problems with lung development that can be critical after birth.<br />\n<br />\nAfter 23 weeks your baby does not need the amniotic fluid so much, so low levels of fluid may not be a problem in itself, but if the low levels are due to your waters breaking then there is a risk of infection..<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2\u2014</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_152MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_152BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_152B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_153B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c946919382513416510\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_153M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/epidurals-when-chutney-mary-fails-her.html?showComment=1479361809557#c946919382513416510\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">November 17, 2016 at 11:20 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_153MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nYou may also be treated with antibiotics, corticosteroids and magnesium sulphate (if you are less than 30 weeks) to help prepare your baby in case the baby is premature<br />\n<br />\nWater bag is a special cushion for your baby. It gives your baby freedom to move within your body, and it gives the space so that when someone taps your belly, your baby isn\u2019t in danger of a bruise.<br />\n<br />\nAnd it helps regulate the temperature, so that your baby stays warm in the winter and cool in the summer. A woman should always mark the time when her water breaks<br />\n<br />\nmost doctors want the baby to be born within 24 hours to ensure that the baby is healthy. Sometimes, the doctor will give a woman some time for the contractions to begin on their own, but if they don\u2019t within 12 hours or so, that may mean that the doctor recommends an induction, unless the baby would be premature.<br />\n<br />\nOne of the biggest dangers of water breaking before labor begins is the danger of the umbilical cord getting in the way. It\u2019s called umbilical cord prolapse, and if the cord is in the way, it could get compressed by the baby in the birth canal.<br />\n<br />\nThe umbilical cord is still helping your baby get blood and oxygen during the delivery, and it is a big deal if that flow gets cut off. In fact, an umbilical cord prolapse usually results in a doctor recommending a C-section.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_154b+seedgJQD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_154b+seedgJQD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"></b><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4580936472811658768\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_223M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is often known\nas the \"hormone of love\" because it is involved with lovemaking,\nfertility, contractions during labor and birth and the release of milk in breastfeeding.\nIt helps us feel good, and it triggers nurturing feelings and behaviors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is responsible\nfor stimulation of milk ejection (milk letdown) and for stimulation of uterine\nsmooth muscle contraction at birth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is released as\nsoon as &nbsp;the mother hears the FIRST cries\nof her child.&nbsp; This works like a divine mantra.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UYJ1pePQla0/WCg0PgSQbxI/AAAAAAABPG0/n8iqmOjjubIOKz_xP0NO4cofYOJ-IYaaACLcB/s1600/oxytocWWEin.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin stimulates\npowerful contractions that help to thin and open (dilate) the cervix, move the\nbaby down and out of the birth canal, push out the placenta, and limit bleeding\nat the site of the placenta.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-I8zQAXZ0RLA/WCg0AhIFAXI/AAAAAAABPGs/ZXmeu95SauIf-cgpIZKbYJ8SbN1Iw--GgCLcB/s1600/18a6eb5WWWWfb831931f21f414aa284fab81.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"368\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-I8zQAXZ0RLA/WCg0AhIFAXI/AAAAAAABPGs/ZXmeu95SauIf-cgpIZKbYJ8SbN1Iw--GgCLcB/s640/18a6eb5WWWWfb831931f21f414aa284fab81.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During labor and birth, the pressure of the baby\nagainst your cervix, and then against tissues in the pelvic floor, stimulates\noxytocin and contractions.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IJ5XZNqXBPk/WCg1fZDQlsI/AAAAAAABPHA/OgQGDR1SC3cWzQ8ThIO2IswoVeWrU-gQQCLcB/s1600/slidTTTTe_66.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IJ5XZNqXBPk/WCg1fZDQlsI/AAAAAAABPHA/OgQGDR1SC3cWzQ8ThIO2IswoVeWrU-gQQCLcB/s640/slidTTTTe_66.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin, delivers the\nmilk that prolactin has produced. The baby's suckling at the breast does two\nthings - it brings milk out with its suction, and, it sends an important\nmessage to the mother's pituitary gland, via the nipples' nerve endings, the\nthoracic nerves, and the hypothalamus to send more milk out!&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pituitary\nresponds by manufacturing oxytocin, which makes the tiny muscles lining the\nlobules contract and squirt milk out from the breast.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When the hind milk is\ncalled forward by the oxytocin, new hind milk is created, ready to be called forward.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unlike prolactin, oxytocin does not exist in the body until the\nsuckling process calls it forth.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suckling, therefore,\ndoes two things: it stimulates prolactin to make milk, and it stimulates\noxytocin to deliver milk. It is very much a demand-and-supply process.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MgVklmluDEk/WCgxaNBezYI/AAAAAAABPGQ/6cKtjKQwXlEe4Rb2eg6MGCGJOq912RDGQCLcB/s1600/figueere_06_03_labeled.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MgVklmluDEk/WCgxaNBezYI/AAAAAAABPGQ/6cKtjKQwXlEe4Rb2eg6MGCGJOq912RDGQCLcB/s640/figueere_06_03_labeled.jpg\" width=\"534\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The prolactin level,\nhigh during pregnancy, drifts down to its normal level after the baby is born.\nBy the end of the first week after birth, prolactin is down to 50 percent of\nits normal level, and after three or four months, it is the same as it was\nbefore pregnancy.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-k77GWsDqfg0/WCgxFBimYHI/AAAAAAABPGI/cOC3KJPKY8cs96q1WQ9hBHthJjZQbVXcgCLcB/s1600/figure_e416_05_1_labeled.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"432\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-k77GWsDqfg0/WCgxFBimYHI/AAAAAAABPGI/cOC3KJPKY8cs96q1WQ9hBHthJjZQbVXcgCLcB/s640/figure_e416_05_1_labeled.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But every time the baby suckles, there is a new burst of\nprolactin telling the body to make milk and a burst of oxytocin telling it to\nrelease the milk into the baby's mouth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The more the mother nurses the baby,\nthe more milk the body will produce. The baby cannot ever use up the milk in\nthe breasts; suckling is simply the message to the body to make more of it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin also\ncounteracts fear, which is associated with high cortisol levels and stress,\nOxytocin leads to strong pair-bonding.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/qJj_-3dZ4ZQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/qJj_-3dZ4ZQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many other\nbenefits of oxytocin. It increases immunity, speeds up wound healing, slows down\ncell-aging and increases life-expectancy, mood stability and one's sense of\nwell-being.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Labour and birth\ninvolve peak levels of the hormones oxytocin, called the hormone of love, and\nprolactin \u2013 the mothering hormone. These two hormones are &nbsp;best known for their role in breastfeeding.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9eFc5Ohz1ZQ/WCgym8D7IPI/AAAAAAABPGc/LEukmE_JjN0KVGs5jlZsQPzZZV1cwiXIACLcB/s1600/hoddrm.re8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9eFc5Ohz1ZQ/WCgym8D7IPI/AAAAAAABPGc/LEukmE_JjN0KVGs5jlZsQPzZZV1cwiXIACLcB/s640/hoddrm.re8.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is the hormone\nthat causes the uterus to contract during labour. Levels of oxytocin gradually\nincrease throughout labour, and are highest around the time of birth, when it\ncontributes to the euphoria and receptiveness to her baby that a mother usually\nfeels after an unmedicated birth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-efQFCQaTjTg/WCgy99RKVfI/AAAAAAABPGg/U7qdlkeCz14X28C5eCtdHyQFZkQssTakwCLcB/s1600/drrownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"208\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-efQFCQaTjTg/WCgy99RKVfI/AAAAAAABPGg/U7qdlkeCz14X28C5eCtdHyQFZkQssTakwCLcB/s400/drrownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This peak, which is\ntriggered by sensations of stretching of the birth canal as the baby is born,\ndoes not occur when an epidural is in place. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic oxytocin is\noften given by drip to Chutney Marys \u2013 that is, directly into the bloodstream \u2013\nwhen labour contractions are inefficient.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;Oxytocin given in this way does\nnot enter the brain, and so does not contribute to the post-birth \u201chigh\u201d, and\nin fact can lead to a reduction in a mothers own oxytocin production. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin has another\ncrucial role to play after the birth. margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-X22GikxvlXk/WChy_MHGm5I/AAAAAAABPIg/fWsgkUIYxH8i1f2f6Ng3ctTKmDy4nbPUACLcB/s1600/irrr5mages.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The period after orgasm\n(known as the refractory period) is often a relaxing experience, attributed to\nthe release of the neurohormones oxytocin and prolactin as well as endorphins\n(or \"endogenous morphine\").<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qkEOucmebtk/WChyq04U-4I/AAAAAAABPIY/IdmyR50Kj8c7PwfYjmfK8LWCFldRD4sIgCLcB/s1600/diagraeeeeem32.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"434\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qkEOucmebtk/WChyq04U-4I/AAAAAAABPIY/IdmyR50Kj8c7PwfYjmfK8LWCFldRD4sIgCLcB/s640/diagraeeeeem32.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An increased infusion\nof the hormone oxytocin during ejaculation is responsible for the refractory\nperiod, and the amount by which oxytocin is increased may affect the length of\neach refractory period.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another chemical which\nis considered to be responsible for the male refractory period is prolactin,\nwhich represses dopamine, which is responsible for sexual arousal. ....&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nare several hormones involved in sexual relationships; most important of these\nare two: dopamine and oxytocin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin,&nbsp; is the hormone that increases with long-term\nrelationships.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is the social\npair-bonding courage-boosting \"cuddling hormone,\" that bonds us with\nsomeone. &nbsp;&nbsp;It's naturally released by touching, hugging,\nlabor, lactation, high temperature, self-hugging, &nbsp;fetal positions, etc. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although oxytocin takes\nlonger than dopamine to be released, its effect is safer, deeper, and\nlong-enduring. It freely increases without going through the addictive cycle of\ndopamine's highs-and-lows; and it even keeps dopamine from wearing off.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On delivery day and the\ndays after, the rush of oxytocin makes some women extra friendly toward nurses,\ndoctors and visitors, over-thanking everyone for being so kind, although they\nonly do their job.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you rub the\nback/nape of your pet or child, you may find him/her strangely relaxed,\ntrusting and easy-going.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Next time you see a dog\njust use your fingers and tickle behind the ears -- &nbsp;it wants this feel good factor , more than food as a reward.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is also the\nchemical driving the tribe or herd instinct, which, like any instinct, can do\nmore harm than good when followed blindly, causing bias, dependence,\nattachment, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is now\nmanufactured by big pharmaceutical companies. It's been introduced to the\nmarket under different brand names, like Liquid Trust Spray. &nbsp;&nbsp;When oxytocin is taken in doses or as a spray\nit causes relaxation and arousal in most men and women.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manufactured oxytocin\nis given to people with autism and social phobia to help them face society.&nbsp; However, when taken at the wrong time it can\nmake a person more naive and gullible, trusting the wrong people.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For\ninstance, a woman who takes it for arousal might trust a new date that turns\nout to be a psychopath/rapist/murderer. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxytocin is the\nfear-killing hormone, notwithstanding the consequences. &nbsp;&nbsp;This is\nwhy true lovers are not afraid of committing suicide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although a long-term\npartnership is good for stimulating oxytocin, partners should also\n\"work\" on keeping the flame of love, to reap dopamine's benefits too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When prolactin is\ncombined with oxytocin, as it is soon after birth and during breastfeeding, it\nencourages a relaxed and selfless devotion to the baby that contributes to a\nmother\u2019s satisfaction and her baby\u2019s physical and emotional health.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beta-endorphin also\nswitches on learning and memory, perhaps explaining why we remember our labour\nand birth in such amazing detail. &nbsp;Like\noxytocin, endorphin hormones can induce a euphoria and are also released during\nlovemaking and breastfeeding.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breastfeeding releases\nbeneficial hormones into the mother's body. &nbsp;Oxytocin and prolactin hormones relax the\nmother and increase her nurturing response. &nbsp;This hormone release can help to enable sleep.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breastfeeding soon\nafter birth increases the mother's oxytocin levels, making her uterus contract\nmore quickly and reducing bleeding. &nbsp;Pitocin, a synthetic hormone used to make the\nuterus contract during and after labour, is structurally modelled on oxytocin.&nbsp; &nbsp;Syntocinon, another synthetic oxytocic, is\ncommonly used in the west.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Oxytocin contracts the\nsmooth muscle of the uterus during and after birth, and during orgasm(s).&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tFpBdf99QkA/WCiBLmyZbJI/AAAAAAABPI4/lHYmk8XEi80jY_hWUcniC_aNxDzY-K0xwCLcB/s1600/sldd4ide_6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tFpBdf99QkA/WCiBLmyZbJI/AAAAAAABPI4/lHYmk8XEi80jY_hWUcniC_aNxDzY-K0xwCLcB/s640/sldd4ide_6.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">After\nbirth, oxytocin contracts the smooth muscle layer of band-like cells\nsurrounding the alveoli to squeeze the newly produced milk into the duct\nsystem. Oxytocin is necessary for the milk ejection reflex, or let-down, in\nresponse to suckling, to occur.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suckling by the baby\nstimulates the paraventricular nuclei and supraoptic nucleus in the\nhypothalamus, which signals to the posterior pituitary gland to produce\noxytocin. Oxytocin stimulates contraction of the myoepithelial cells\nsurrounding the alveoli, which already hold milk. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ONzh4rWQC7Q/WCiA_QF5YHI/AAAAAAABPI0/LLp7ODVZP9k6rZ94TeAui-PksvasdXCQQCLcB/s1600/slide_3rrrr3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ONzh4rWQC7Q/WCiA_QF5YHI/AAAAAAABPI0/LLp7ODVZP9k6rZ94TeAui-PksvasdXCQQCLcB/s1600/slide_3rrrr3.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The increased pressure\ncauses milk to flow through the duct system and be released through the nipple.\nThis response can be conditioned e.g. to the cry of the baby.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stress or anxiety can\ncause difficulties with breastfeeding. The release of the hormone oxytocin\nleads to the milk ejection or let-down reflex. Oxytocin stimulates the muscles\nsurrounding the breast to squeeze out the milk. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A surge of oxytocin\nalso causes the uterus to contract. During breastfeeding, mothers may feel\nthese contractions as afterpains. These may range from period-like cramps to\nstrong labour-like contractions&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who are exposed\nto higher levels of oxytocin develop a greater level of trust towards a\npermanent partner.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Prolactin </b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">is produced\nby a group of cells called lactotrophs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin is a hormone\nthat stimulates and maintain milk secretion in a woman who is breastfeeding her\nchild. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Prolactin, encourages\nand enhances the breast development as well as the milk production during\npregnancy and after childbirth. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Suckling by the newborn\nbaby increases prolactin levels; early and frequent suckling from the first\ndays makes the breast more responsive to prolactin, which in turn helps to\nensure a good long-term supply of milk.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In a healthy woman who\nis not pregnant, the prolactin levels should be low. &nbsp;If the prolactin level is high, it interrupts\nyour menstrual cycle and ovulation and lead to infertility.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both men and women\nproduce prolactin. In certain cases, the levels of prolactin can be higher,\ncausing a decreased libido, irregular menstruation, subfertility and other\nproblems in women. If the levels of prolactin are higher in men, reduced muscle\nmass, erectile dysfunction and decreased libido are common.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lactotrophs are found in the pituitary\ngland and will pump out this hormone as much as they can, never ceasing in this\nproduction unless made to by an inhibitory factor. The main one controlling the\nrelease into the system is that of the neurotransmitter dopamine. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But interestingly enough, prolactin itself\npromotes dopamine. This ensures that prolactin release does not become a\nproblem in of itself. A perfect example of the bodies proclivities for negative\nfeed-back loops to control itself.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">The posterior pituitary controls oxytocin release while the anterior pituitary controls prolactin release</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OYG0F-qTfyo/WCklrLJbsnI/AAAAAAABPJI/nIAuUkTuYlEKNRIiBEP1HfnIJq37czQsACLcB/s1600/pituitattry-gland.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OYG0F-qTfyo/WCklrLJbsnI/AAAAAAABPJI/nIAuUkTuYlEKNRIiBEP1HfnIJq37czQsACLcB/s640/pituitattry-gland.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting pregnant with\nhigh prolactin levels is very difficult.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High levels of\nprolactin can be caused by a number of things. One of the most common is\nprescription medications, lack of sleep, or extreme stress or strenuous\nexercise. Sometimes there are more serious reasons for high prolactin levels,\nincluding a tumor on the pituitary gland, or sometimes PCOS (&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Polycystic ovary syndrome )&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">can also be to\nblame.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/06/chembu-kizhangu-colocasia-and-pms.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/06/chembu-kizhangu-colocasia-and-pms.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you notice&nbsp; a problem&nbsp;\nwith your periods or ovulation, you need to test your prolactin levels.\nThe test is a simple blood test that takes few minutes. The test is done during\nyour menstrual cycle. It won\u2019t take much time to get the results.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The release of excess\nprolactin has been found to decrease testosterone.&nbsp; &nbsp;Another\nimportant job prolactin have is its connection to sleep. Levels raise during\nsleep. This is why after a male releases his seed, sleep often becomes an\nunstoppable force, &nbsp;as most women are\naware of.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By raising dopamine, we\nlower prolactin. , Prolactin levels were lowered in all the stressed groups\nthat took Ashwagandha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: lime; color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/03/quantum-medicine-ashwagandha-and-your.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/03/quantum-medicine-ashwagandha-and-your.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After orgasm, the body\nreleases high amounts of prolactin to help counter the dopamine that led to\nsexual arousal. &nbsp;As long as the prolactin\nlevels are raised, men become uninterested in sex. This is what is known as the\nrefractory period, when men are unable to achieve an erection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Male orgasm releases\nprolactin..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men with elevated\nlevels of prolactin experience symptoms of sexual dysfunction. They have low\nsexual interest and often are unable to achieve an erection like TATTU Pickle\nJohn. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men with sleep apnea\nhave elevated levels of prolactin. &nbsp;Prolactin\nlevels surge at the onset of sleep, and they reach peak levels during REM sleep<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients with\nhyperprolactinemia ( high prolactin levels )&nbsp;\noften present with emotional difficulties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin acts upon the\ncentral nervous system and variations in its concentrations do affect mood,\nemotions and behavior\u2026there is wide agreement that patients with\nhyperprolactinemia present with an unusal prevalence of depressive\ndisorders\u2026depressed mood, loss of interest in unusual pleasures, decreased\nlibido and irritability predominate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High prolactin levels &nbsp;a symptom of anxiety and depression and it\naffects both men and women.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The effects of high\nprolactin levels on men include low testosterone, low sperm count and volume,\nlow libido, breast tenderness and male lactation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remember that prolactin\nis a \"lactation hormone\" and can trigger gyno.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-G6mXxqWxvZQ/WCkv7iJjpuI/AAAAAAABPJg/cnSObYdp780Y92XIUYUizDSj6Plg4CXtACLcB/s1600/gynecddo-01.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-G6mXxqWxvZQ/WCkv7iJjpuI/AAAAAAABPJg/cnSObYdp780Y92XIUYUizDSj6Plg4CXtACLcB/s400/gynecddo-01.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gynecomastia is triggered\nby a decrease in the amount of the hormone testosterone compared with estrogen.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nextreme cases, gyno can even trigger milk production from men\u2019s boobs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin lowers\ndopamine.&nbsp; It raises inflammation. So you\ndon't definitely don't want too much of it, and guys can feel it very often. &nbsp;An underactive thyroid will also drive up\nprolactin levels in us men.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of course,\nthis is an especially ugly situation, because hypothyroidism tends to lower\ntestosterone and sap your energy levels.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, if you have hypothyroidism and high prolactin, you have potentially\ngot a nasty set of symptoms to manage, and Chutney Mary is gonna do NAG NAG\nNAG.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men with erectile\ndysfunction who are found to have a low testosterone level should have a\nmeasurement of their prolactin level. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Western\ntreatment consists of lowering the prolactin level by medication or surgery, or\nboth. &nbsp;The allopathy &nbsp;doctors use &nbsp;Bromocriptine, ( has side effects ) &nbsp;a dopamine agonist, to lower elevated\nprolactin levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ejaculation results in\nchanges in prolactin (increase) and dopamine (temporary decrease)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dopamine is reduced\ntemporarily as prolactin rises, as the two can be seen as antagonistic of each\nother<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orgasm can cause a\nsignificant spike in prolactin levels (approximately 10 to 15ng/ml) immediately\nafter and upwards to 10-20 minutes later, at which it starts to decline<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin increase after\nintercourse is 400 percent greater than that following masturbation. From these\nstudies, it was concluded that intercourse is more physiologically satisfying\nthan masturbation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some prescription\nmedicines can raise prolactin levels.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These include estrogen, opiate\npainkillers, metoclopramide to treat heartburn or gastroesophageal reflux, and\nantipsychotics for serious mental illness. Also, some medicines used to treat\nhigh blood pressure, depression, and ulcers can increase prolactin levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you have\ninfertility, low sex drive, and low bone mass, you may receive allopathy treatment\nwith estrogen (for women) or testosterone (for men).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no need to get\nprolactin blood tests while you are pregnant. &nbsp;&nbsp;Prolactin levels are normally high during\npregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your doctor may request\nan MRI scan to check if a prolactinoma tumor is causing your prolactin levels\nto rise. Your doctor will prescribe medication to shrink any existing tumor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-F4eEOMM3WCE/WCkxJdVUSyI/AAAAAAABPJk/Zo7eOM9s-IA7nSW2A0DkxARrwnvXMiyvwCLcB/s1600/prolactirrrnoma.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"456\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-F4eEOMM3WCE/WCkxJdVUSyI/AAAAAAABPJk/Zo7eOM9s-IA7nSW2A0DkxARrwnvXMiyvwCLcB/s640/prolactirrrnoma.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin is known as\nthe \u201cmothering\u201d hormone.&nbsp; Prolactin &nbsp;increases during pregnancy and peaks when\nlabor starts on its own.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Continued prolactin production during and after labor\nappears to be readying a woman\u2019s body for breastfeeding. It may also play a\nrole in moving labor along and helping the newborn adjust to life outside the\nwomb. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin is central to breast\nmilk production. High levels of prolactin with early breastfeeding &nbsp;fosters &nbsp;women\u2019s caretaking behaviors and adjustment to\nbeing a mother. This hormone &nbsp;supports\nthe infant\u2019s healthy development.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin is absolutely\ncrucial to the potential to breastfeed - without it, there will never be any\nmilk.&nbsp; &nbsp;It begins its work about the eighth week of\npregnancy and slowly increases in amount for the next seven months, peaking at\nthe baby's birth. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With this high level\nof prolactin coursing through the body, a woman would begin to spout out milk\nright away, except that the body is also producing high levels of estrogen and\nprogesterone, which block some of the prolactin receptors and inhibit milk\nproduction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the baby is born\nand the placenta has been delivered, the levels of estrogen and progesterone\ndrop quickly, while the prolactin levels begin a much slower decline, and this\nis the sign for the breasts to begin producing milk.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The milk, however, does\nnot come right away. It takes between three and five days, during which time\nthe breasts are making another liquid, a sort of pre-milk called colostrum,\nwhich the baby drinks before the milk it will soon get.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Colostrum is filled\nwith antibodies, which help the infant fight off infections.&nbsp; Colostrum decreases the baby's chances of\nlater developing allergies and asthma. Soon the baby's own immune system has\nbegun to develop, and he or she no longer needs the antibodies supplied by\ncolostrum.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Colostrum is the first\nmilk a breastfed baby receives. It contains higher amounts of white blood cells\nand antibodies than mature milk, and is especially high in immunoglobulin A\n(IgA), which coats the lining of the baby's immature intestines, and helps to\nprevent pathogens from invading the baby's system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secretory IgA also helps\nprevent food allergies. Over the first two weeks after the birth, colostrum\nproduction slowly gives way to mature breast milk.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lot of auto immune problems\ndumped as genetic is caused to to the western mother refusing to feed her baby\nwith berast milks as her AARRGGHH&nbsp; &nbsp;PPTTHHEEOOOYY silicone boobs may lose its\nstyle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/allergy-overkill-response-of-squeamish.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/allergy-overkill-response-of-squeamish.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/sikha-kudumi-choti-open-flag-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/sikha-kudumi-choti-open-flag-of.html</a><o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similar to female\nparents, elevated prolactin levels in new fathers contribute to child-caring\nbehavior and facilitate behavioral and emotional states attributed to child\ncare.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elevated parental prolactin levels after childbirth decrease the parents'\nlibidos so that they invest more in parental care than in LUSTFUL behavior and\nanal sex.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like the other\nhormones, prolactin has effects on emotion and behaviour. &nbsp;&nbsp;Prolactin stimulates \u2018aggressively defensive\u2019\nbehaviour in breastfeeding mothers- &nbsp;what\nwe call the \u2018tiger mother\u2019 effect. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prolactin helps us to put our babies needs first in all\nsituations by increasing submissiveness, anxiety and vigilance.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are slums in India where the mother and\nbaby sleep just three metres off the railway track. A dozen express trains can\nscreech past, the mother wont wake up. &nbsp;But if her baby even whimpers in his\nsleep, the mother will wake up.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tsX1dH4eVCU/WCk2LeuQoaI/AAAAAAABPJ0/UzKSIKJVaPcuKtUUVKI7rrpKbh2B0P55gCLcB/s1600/6660.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
